intro: Nesaea lanceolata var. pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered nesaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features lanceolate leaves that are often pubescent, giving it its varietal name. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with a distinctive, slightly hairy appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
